The expert analyzed the statements made: S. Rep. Bob Goodlatte, R-6th, on ABC's "This Week with George Stephanopoulos" regarding the decrease in federal prosecutions for lying on background checks.
The expert obtained data from the Nation: a Syracuse University website that collects data from the Department of Justice.
The expert focused specifically on prose: excluding other gun offenses and state prosecutions, as the claim made by Goodlatte referred to the presidential role in enforcement.
By comparing the available data from for: Bush's administration (2002-2003 and 2005-2008) with the limited data from President Barack Obama's administration (2009-2010), the expert determined that there was a 42 percent decline in federal prosecutions for lying on background checks.
